metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10907 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was found that glusterfs server is vulnerable to multiple stack basedbuffer overflows due to functions in server-rpc-fopc.c allocating fixedsize buffers using 'alloca(3)'. An authenticated attacker could exploitthis by mounting a gluster volume and sending a string longer that thefixed buffer size to cause crash or potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10907` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glusterfs-client - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-common - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
glusterfs-server - 3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glusterfs package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.6-1ubuntu1+esm1').
